definition: to turn hostile suddenly/face changing, a device of Sichuan Opera, a dramatic change of attitude expressing fright, anger etc
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: It is said the origin of face changing has something to do with the resistance of wild beasts.
sentences.chinese: 相传“变脸”的由来与古代人们应对野兽侵犯有关。

sentences.english: I have determined to do this city harm and not good, declares the LORD .
sentences.chinese: 耶和华说，我向这城变脸，降祸不降福。

sentences.english: The venerable Hypertext Markup Language is getting a face lift, too.
sentences.chinese: 流行的超文本标记语言也正在进行大变脸。

sentences.english: There are major parts on the face of maintenance equipment and maintenance and production methods.
sentences.chinese: 还有变脸器具上各大配件的保养与维护以及制作方法。

sentences.english: Face in order to develop a separate program, known the world.
sentences.chinese: 变脸从而发展成为单独的节目，响誉世界。

sentences.english: Thus face changing became a special art form of Sichuan opera.
sentences.chinese: 这样，变脸就成为川剧中的一种艺术特技。

sentences.english: Status Offline The winter had almost guttered into spring when father was ill.
sentences.chinese: 冬天悄然变脸化作春天之际，爸爸病了。

sentences.english: So owe like our Chinese teacher very much!
sentences.chinese: 我们的老师会变脸，也很幽默。
